Nice. Is that a Sileighty or a Camaro? I don't know cars...
You hear that? That was my jaw shattering as it hit the floor.
Ksp won the unity award for best gameplay!!!!!!!

hello.

in real life an orbit would be 400km but for ksp I would run any station you have at maybe 125km for 2 reasons.

one speed faster timewarp than if you were at 100km

and so multiple trips to orbit would work out less distance travelled.

once we have a page up and running we can increase fuel levels for the next version if required.

thanks

perfect. thanks man! i'm still relatively new to ksp and I keep having issues when I add payload because my shuttle is heavy. I don't know much about deltaV And with only a A&P license understanding of thrust to weight ratio lol I ran out of electricity with one shuttle so I thought a rocket inside the payload would work but I run out of fuel again lol

Hello, yes the shuttle was made to be realistic to be a good simulation.

First you must activate the generator in the shutyle to make power. It uses fuel to run.

What sort of altitude are you trying to reach? And what tyoe of fuel do you run out of?

Thanks
